Explanation: The doctor suggested a rapid strep test, which is similar to the throat swab for rapid antigen detection test (RADT) as both aim to identify Group A Streptococcus to rule out strep throat.
The doctor suggested a throat swab for bacterial culture, which aligns with the need to confirm a bacterial infection if the rapid strep test is negative.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations similar to 'Complete blood count (CBC)' or provide a justification related to checking for signs of infection or inflammation.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations similar to the Monospot test or provide a justification related to ruling out infectious mononucleosis.
The doctor did not suggest any investigations related to assessing inflammation levels, such as C-reactive protein (CRP), which would be relevant for determining the severity of the infection.
